text: You don’t even need to bring the lands back. He stays huge and native trample.
And reach.
I have a soft spot for Multani, so I think it’d be cool.
[[!Natural Balance]] and such
I know the general concensus is Multani is bulk, and that's not wrong I guess, but I have two decks that want him
I don’t know...his native trample and reach make him pretty easy to setup for a one-hit kill.
I like multani
Omnath seems better tho
Probably but Multani might have more wierd builds like MLD if that's your thing. Omanath is pretty straight forward.
What MLD is in mono green, though?
[[Tsunami]]
Or animating I guess, but it's hard in mono to kill them then
Or just 'play with lands'

text:
Sometimes, I have ideas that I know are terrible, but I can’t help but want to try for the one time it works.

Currently, the idea that falls under this category is turning my lands in to creatures, and then using Thromok to devour all of them. Maybe using splendid reclamation or world shaped to get them all back
That is a terrible, beautiful idea.
Maybe drop the Mending of Dominaria before you go off as extra insurance.
I also keep on coming back to the idea of manlands
I sort of have a K&T build around it, but it is not good at all.
I doubt I build it, but I’ve always found devour to be a cool, if admittedly terrible, ability
Terrible?
K and T can be built so many different ways. The more I see them and play with them, the more I like them
Devour makes Thromok terrifying.
Yes, they're verse, if you will.
Terrible might be a bit hyperbolic. But sacrificing your board to then lose everything to a swords, path, or wrath is bad
Indestructible hexproof is your friend.
Gotta save that Heroic Intervention for such a time as this
Also [[Mages' Contest]]

attachments.fallback: Mages' Contest {1}{R}{R} // Instant // You and target spell's controller bid life. You start the bidding with a bid of 1. In turn order, each player may top the high bid. The bidding ends if the high bid stands. The high bidder loses life equal to the high bid. If you win the bidding, counter that spell.
attachments.text:
Instant
You and target spell's controller bid life. You start the bidding with a bid of 1. In turn order, each player may top the high bid. The bidding ends if the high bid stands. The high bidder loses life equal to the high bid. If you win the bidding, counter that spell.
